thread.title: Ex-Everton and Leeds midfielder Olivier Dacourt once SUED Donald Trump over investment deal
thread.title_full: Ex-Everton and Leeds midfielder Olivier Dacourt once SUED Donald Trump over investment deal

author: Mark Jones
title: Ex-Everton and Leeds midfielder Olivier Dacourt once SUED Donald Trump over investment deal
text:
Remember Olivier Dacourt ? 
The combative French midfielder was a decent player back in the day, appearing for Everton in the 1998/99 season before later moving to Leeds United for three years. 
He also had successful spells at Roma and Inter Milan, while winning 21 caps for his country. But that isn't why you're here, is it? Dacourt in his Leeds days on the far right (no Trump jokes please) (Photo: Reuters) 
Nope, you're here because it has been revealed - via The New York Times - that Dacourt once sued the newly most powerful man in the world, Donald Trump . Although we'll have to ask Donald whether that's FAKE NEWS or not. The main man (Photo: Getty) 
As the story goes, Dacourt was one of the earliest investors in "Trump SoHo", a luxury hotel project in Lower Manhattan, and he put down $460,400 on a unit which cost $2.3million in total. 
Bit when the deal never happened, Dacourt joined forces with other investors to sue the current President. 
Trump and co ended up paying out the vast majority of the $3.16 million in deposits they had been paid, even though he refused to admit he'd done anything wrong. He probably loves this picture (Photo: PA) 
Dacourt, meanwhile, faded back into relative obscurity. 
There are plenty who wish Trump had done the same. Like us on Facebook
